name: Request-Requests-GET-getRequests
description: [Request] GET /requests/{ID} — Retrieves the request with the specified ID.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

name: Request-Types-GET-getTypes
description: [Request] GET /types — Retrieves a collection of request types.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

schema.name: requestBody
schema.description: JSON request body.

name: Request-Requests-GET-getRequests_1
description: [Request] GET /requests — Retrieves a collection of in progress requests based on the specified parameters.

schema.name: completedOnOrAfter
schema.description: query parameter: completedOnOrAfter

schema.name: completedOnOrBefore
schema.description: query parameter: completedOnOrBefore

schema.name: initiatedOnOrAfter
schema.description: query parameter: initiatedOnOrAfter

schema.name: initiatedOnOrBefore
schema.description: query parameter: initiatedOnOrBefore

schema.name: initiator
schema.description: The WID for the person who initiated the request. You can GET /workers in the /common service to retrieve a worker's WID.

schema.name: limit
schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

schema.name: offset
schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

schema.name: onBehalfOf
schema.description: The Workday ID of the person this request is being initiated on behalf of.

schema.name: requestId
schema.description: The ID of the request based on the ID generator format.

schema.name: requestSubtype
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the request subtype. You can specify more than 1 requestSubtype query parameter. 
You can call GET /requests/query/values/requestSubtype to retrieve a valid ID.

schema.name: requestType
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the request type. You can specify more than 1 requestType query parameter.
You can call GET /requests/query/values/requestType to retrieve a valid ID.

schema.name: resolution
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the resolution of the request. You can specify more than 1 resolution query parameter.
Valid values:

* 47fa99d9ed671000111f2f4d1d6f37ea - Done

* be256002ae2010000c0b9b59ca1d014b - Duplicate

* be256002ae2010000c0b9c817aea014c - Denied

* be256002ae2010000bfd6ae5ea5b0148 - Canceled

schema.name: resolutionDetails
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the resolution details. You can specify more than 1 resolutionDetails query parameter.
You can call GET /requests/query/values/resolutionDetails to retrieve a valid ID.

schema.name: workdayObjectValue
schema.description:
The Workday ID of the business object associated with the request. 
Call the corresponding GET endpoint on the business object resource in the appropriate REST service to get a valid ID.

schema.name: requestBody
schema.description: JSON request body.

schema.name: ID
schema.description: The Workday ID of the resource.
